section.title: OFBiz SeleniumXml
section.para: This is a short document to help you get started using SeleniumXml to test your OFBiz application. Here is a copy of the presentation that was given at the ApacheCon2008 OFBiz Conference that describes more about the project.

section.title: Installing SeleniumXml

listitem.para: From the ofbiz directory run the following ant command to download the needed selenium- server.jar file.
ant run-install-extseed (For run install help data and example test)
Build the source by running "ant" in the testtools directory or your OFBIZ_HOME

section.para: You should now have everything you need to run a seleniumXml test.

section.title: Running the Example Test
section.para: SeleniumXml requires the selenium server to be running. The selenium server uses a default proxy port of 4444. The default port can be changed when you start the server. Selenium tries to automatically change the proxy settings in the testing browser. If you are getting communication errors with the server you may have to manually change your proxy settings in your browser.

section.title: 1. Start ofbiz as normal.
section.para: Note: Before run ofbiz with selenium should changes ofbiz to use HTTP as the default at file (framework/webapp/config/url.properties) . Instead everything just works through port 8080. Selenium supports https but it is more complicated so for this introduction I have turned https off.

section.title: 3. Change the configuration for your preferred browser
section.para: In the testtools/config/seleniumxml.properties file: the default is firefox (e.g. browser=*firefox) but you can change it to any of the selenium supported browsers.

para.link: Selenium supported browsers you can find here

section.title: 4.1 run the Example test .bat/.sh file
section.para: The above test combines three different tests into a single test suite. Data is passed from one test to another to allow you to share generated data.
You will get an assertion (or other exception) if the test fails.
The test uses a .5 second delay for demo purposes. (see example_testsuite.xml and the setSpeed value="500" command). You can remove this at the start of the test if you don't want the delay

section.title: 4.2 run the Example test webtools/Run Selenium
section.para: First you need to open the file example_testsuite.xml and comment out first part.. and enable the bottom one Here is another way to run the selenium test suite and you can create new test suite for your web application. Scroll up on this page then you will see the link "Run Selenium" next to "Selenium Intro" click on that link. On that page you will see the list of available test suites. So you can click on "Run" to run the test suite you want but please remember that the Selenium server should be started before you "run" any test. You can also create new test suite by fill in the information to the form and put the directory location of your test suite in the field "Test Suite Path" then submit. If you want to know how the test is created you can take a look at the file example_testsuite.xml for more info.

section.title: Creating New Tests :
section.para: The easiest way to create a new test is to use the Selenium IDE plugin for Firefox. This allows you to records your own Selenium tests. You can then save the test and convert it to a seleniumXml test easily.

listitem.para: Record your steps as you run through your ofbiz application.
Then convert the saved XML file using the convertSeleniumIDE.bat script.
Manually modify the commands to suit your needs.
